page.title: 02RADFORD TAE-KWON-DO CLUB
page.content:
First we asked{Master S.S.Vohra}if there had been any knockouts. 'No,' he said, 'because we control the fighting so that when you make contact it is not enough to knock the person out.' Has anyone been put into hospital because of sparring? 'No, people have been in for broken arms and legs.' Has anyone smashed the mirrors in the gym? 'No, not yet.' Has anyone tripped over their belt? 'No!' Why did you choose to put a {Tae-Kwon-Do}club in{Radford?}'Because the{martial arts}are in demand in Radford.{Ilkeston Road}is a busy location and the premises there were up for sale.'
{Stephen Lamb & Graham Mee}
